events.name: OPENING OF GOOGLE DEVELOPING GROUP IN SCE - LETS TALK TECHNOLOGY
events.description:
The Google Developer Group in the Negev.

Covering the developemnt tools and methods for Google platform and Android.
This forum, will discuss and learn about Google technology and services, Google Ajax APIs - maps, search, visualization, gadgets (JavaScript), Android - mobile development (Java) - Google App Engine - scalable cloud computing (Python and Java) - Google Web Toolkit - web development platform (Java) - Project Hosting - Analytics and AdSense - advertising and web analytics.

The opening meeting will include the fowling lectures:
1. Google Developer Toolbox - Amir Shevat, Google Developer Relations
2. From Java to Scala, an Android application case - Itai Dror, CTO, TIKAL
3. C2DM - Connecting to the cloud - Leonid Olevsky, SCE

events.name: GDG Meeting & Drive Hackathon
events.description:

Our main goal is to harness developers with tools and knowledge to implement into their work.

We hope you all enjoy our bootcamp :)

GDG members have a discount of 25 percent to the startup weekend.

Enter this promotion code - SWHNWGK1025 when you registering.

registration - http://swbeersheva.eventbrite.com/

events.name: תחרות פיתוח אפליקציות לבני נוער- גיוס מנטורים
events.description:
הקבוצה שלנו נרתמת לעזרת עמותת תפוח ואנו מזמינים אתכם לבוא ולתרום מהידע שלכם בארוע זה.

בתאריך ה-13.5 מתכנסים כ- 150 חניכי הקורס מכל ישובי הפריפריה בארץ (ק"ש, כרמיאל, נצרת עילית, דימונה, תל אביב , כפר סבא, ב"ש, אשקלון, רמלה) בשלושה מרכזים בארץ לתחרות אדירה של פיתוח אפליקציות WEB.
הרעיון הוא שבמשך לילה לבן הם יפתחו את הרעיון שלהם בליווי מנטורים טכנולוגיים מנוסים, שיתרמו מהידע המקצועי שלהם.

נשמח אם תגיעו וכך נתרום לקהילה שלנו!

events.name: GDG Beer Sheva - UI press
events.description:
Hi all,
This time we will meet for the first time at BGU.

The event will have some cool lectures.

Agenda:
17:30-18:00 - Networking.
18:00-18:10 - GDG Beer Sheva
18:15-19:00 - Yedidel Elhayany, WordPress

Wordpress is an open-source CMS platform, based on PHP and MySQL which has rapidly gained popularity since it's launch several years ago.
Today we will meet Wordpress, it's pros and cons. During the lecture we will taste some of its interesting features, such as the template system, filters & hooks and plugins.

19:00-19:45 - Itamar serfaty,Design 4 Developers.

Today, everyone knows that Winning Design is equally important to the quality of your programming.
Good Design is Accurate Branding, innovative UI, creating aesthetic environment,
But above all, it's responsible for the feeling of your Users.
I invite you to become a Designer for a day, and acquire visual design Abilities.
Instructor:
Itamar serfaty, an interactive Designer and founder of Webbaker school of digital Media.

events.name: Vint Cerf - "the father of the internet" @ Campus TLV

venue.name: Google Tel Aviv Campus
venue.address_1: Electra Tower, 98 Yigal Alon St., 26th floor., Tel Aviv-Yafo

events.description:
On November 7th Campus TLV is delighted to host Vint Cerf, Vice President and Chief Internet Evangelist for Google, that will share his insights with the Israeli technological community.

Widely known as a "Father of the Internet," Vint is the co-designer with Robert Kahn of TCP/IP protocols and basic architecture of the Internet. Today, Dr. Cerf works as the Vice-President for Google where he also serves as Chief Internet Evangelist. Last June, he received the “Queen Elizabeth Prize for Engineering” from the Queen herself which honored only five pioneers of the Internet. Vint is also the president of the ACM. Dr. Cerf is also the recipient of the 2004 ACM Turing Award.

The event will take place on November 7th, 19:00 at Campus TLV (98 Yigal Alon St., Tel Aviv, 26th floor).

Agenda:
19:00 - Welcoming and light refreshment
19:30 - Talk by Vint Cerf and Q&A with Yossi Matias
20:15 - Mingling

events.name: All about WebRTC @ Campus TLV

venue.name: Google Tel Aviv Campus
venue.address_1: Electra Tower, 98 Yigal Alon St., 26th floor., Tel Aviv-Yafo

events.description:
Join us for a great WebRTC event at Campus Tel Aviv.

18th December talks from 5:30pm: 

• Leading WebRTC blogger and industry analyst Tsahi Levent-Levi, 

• Renowned Peer5 developer Hadar Weiss 

• Google  Developer Advocate for Chrome - Sam Dutton.

19th  December from 9:30am: hacking!

Please Register here:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/all-about-webrtc-event-campus-tlv-tickets-9462844623

All About WebRTC 

The trio will give an introduction to WebRTC, show you how to use WebRTC in your web apps, and give you an opportunity to ask your questions.

A follow-up hands-on workshop is planned for the following day, Thursday, 19 December.

Agenda:

Day 1 - December 18th - main event

5:30pm Doors open 
6:00pm Mingle and enjoy refreshments 
6:25pm Welcome notes and introduction 
6:30pm Talk #1 (Sam Dutton) 
7:00pm Break and lightning talks 
7:15pm Talk #2 (Hadar Weiss) 
7:45pm Break and lightning talks 
8:15pm Talk #3 (Tsahi Levent-levi)

Day 2 - December 19th - hands-on workshop

9:30am Doors open 
10:00am Workshop begins 
12:00pm Lunch 
3:00pm Workshop ends (but you can still keep hacking :-)) 
3:00-4:00pm Reception: show off your projects! 
4:00pm Reception ends

Talk #1 Introduction to WebRTC Apps by Sam Dutton

WebRTC implements open standards for peer-to-peer communication of audio, video  and data. WebRTC APIs have been implemented across Chrome and Firefox on mobile and desktop, meaning there are now over one billion end points.

As Brendan Eich put it: "WebRTC is a new front in the long war for an open and unencumbered web."

This session explains how to get started on building a WebRTC app:

• Using getUserMedia() to get access to user-generated video and audio.

• Integrating WebRTC with Canvas, WebGL and Web Audio.

• What is signaling and why do I need it?

• Getting to grips with RTCPeerConnection for audio and video communication.

• Using RTCDataChannel for peer-to-peer data communication for file sharing, gaming and more.

• The easy way: apps, platforms, libraries and abstraction layers.

• Security and privacy.

About the speaker

Sam Dutton is a Developer Advocate for Google Chrome.

Sam maintains simpl.info: simplest-possible examples of HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

He grew up in South Australia, went to university in Sydney, and has lived since 1986 in London. From 2008 to 2010 Sam was a Senior Engineer at BBC R&D Prototyping and WP5 Technical Lead for the P2P-Next project. From 1999 to 2008 Sam worked for ITN, where he built the Shotlister news video cataloguing application using the Qt framework. He's designed and coded lots of web sites, including previous incarnations of itn.co.uk, yellowdiva.com, deccaclassics.comand smithgil.co.uk. He used to be a governor at Ravenstone School in Balham, south London, and co-ran two Code Clubs there.

Tickets for the main event and for the workshop only on EventBrite:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/all-about-webrtc-event-campus-tlv-tickets-9462844623

events.name: Live Webinar ״מה ההזדמנויות עבורך ב- Big Data?"
events.description:
שיתוף פעולה של עמותת בוגרי ממר״ם ומפגשי ״טק-אפ״ ביחד עם GDG באר שבע יוצר עבורכם הזדמנות יוצאת דופן!

מזמינים אתכם לקחת חלק ולהיפגש עם בכירי המומחים שמבין בוגרי ממר״ם, בוובינר

״מה ההזדמנויות עבורך ב- Big Data?"

הוובינר יתקיים , ביום שני ה-[masked], בין השעות 21:30-20:00.

ניתן לקחת חלק פעיל בוובינר, להגיב, לשאול שאלות ולשתף בעצמכם.

ההשתתפות היא בחינם. יש להירשם מראש לחדר ההרצאות הווירטואלי בקישור הבא => 

http://alturl.com/hd2d2

בוובינר נדבר על:

מה זה ביג דאטה ולמה כולם מדברים על זה?

אילו הזדמנויות עסקיות יש במעלה הדרך?

אתגרים במערכות הקלאסיות לטיפול במידע: בסיסי נתונים

מה זה Hadoop? ומה זה Map Reduce?

איך הם מאפשרים התמודדות עם נפחי מידע ענקיים?

מה זה MongoDB ואיך הוא מאפשר להתמודד עם מידע לא מובנה?

מה זה Cassandra ואיך הם מאפשרים להתמודד עם אנליטיקס מבוסס זמן?

כיצד Spart משנה את פני ה- Big Data?

כיצד בונים ארכיטקטורת Big Data שתתאים לכם? 

שאלות ותשובות - תהיה לכם המשתתפים הזדמנות לשאול שאלות.

למי הוובינר מיועד?

יזמים ומנהלי מוצר שרוצים לדעת כיצד הם יכולים למנף את המוצר שלהם להזדמנויות חדשות.

מנהלי פיתוח ו-CTO שרוצים לראות כיצד מערכות ה- Big Data משתלבות בארכיטקטורה ותהליך הפיתוח.

מפתחים שרוצים לדעת איך להשתמש ביכולות החדשות.

אנשי תשתיות, DBA ו- DevOps שרוצים להתעדכן בבשורות האחרונות בעולם.

הכר את המומחה:

משה קפלן, מבכירי בוגרי ממר"ם, הוא Scale Hacker.

משה מלווה ארגונים הנדרשים להתמודד עם השקות גדולות גידול ומהיר בפעילות שלהם ובנפחי המידע עמם הם מתמודדים, משלב התכנון הראשוני ועד המימוש, כולל עם התמודדות עם פערי המצב הקיים.

משה שרת בממר"ם בסדיר ומשרת במילואים כמרצה בבסמ"ח. הוא בעל תואר ראשון במדע המחשב ופיזיקה ותארים שניים בהנדסה ובמנהל עסקים, כולם מאוניברסיטת ת"א.

ההרשמה והשתתפות ללא תשלום - אך כרוכה במילוי פרטיכם בקישור הבא => 

http://alturl.com/hd2d2

אורך הוובינר כשעה וחצי, ובמהלכו יוקצב זמן לשאלות ותשובות.

הוובינר יתחיל בדיוק בזמן, אל תאחרו - מספר המקומות מוגבל!

events.name: Android Wear Design Sprint
events.description:
Designing for any new form factor is hard. 
With Android Wear, you aren't just porting your mobile UI and feature set into a smaller screen.
You're re-designing with a whole new set of paradigms.
Design Sprints are a great way to teach these new paradigms, philosophy, and principles in a hands-on, collaborative way.


The Schedule for this Event : 

18:00-18:30 - Gathering Mingling and drinks.

18:30 - 21:00 - Android wear design sprint. 

 21:00-21:30 - Design results speed showoff

events.name: WearSheva 2014
events.description:
האקתון wearsheva או ״לבושבע״ 
הינו אירוע המפגיש בין מתכנתי מחשב, מפתחי תוכנה, מעצבים גרפיים, מנהלי פרויקטים ובעלי תפקידים אחרים מעולם ההיי-טק לצורך שיתוף פעולה בפיתוח של מספר פרויקטים במקביל.
משך האירוע יהיה כ26-28 שעות. נושאי המפגש הם מגוונים אך מוכללים בתוך תחום המחשוב הלביש לסוגיו וכוללים בין היתר תחומים כגון פיתוח אפליקציות ופיתוח משחקי מחשב.
ההאקתון "לבושבע" שיערך באוני׳ בן גוריון בשיתוף קבוצת GDG באר שבע ומרכז בנג׳יס ליזמות הינו חלק משבוע היזמות שיערך באוני׳ ויהווה גולת כותרת לסיומו של שבוע עתיר אירועים.

כיצד זה עובד ? 
לתחרות יכולים להירשם כ[masked] משתתפים: מפתחים, מתכנתים, מעצבים ויזמים - כל מי שיש לו רעיון לאפליקציה חדשנית הקשורה למחשוב לביש. 
התחרות תחל בהרצאות אורח  ולאחריהן יוזנקו המשתתפים ויחלו בחלוקה לצוותים קטנים ויחלו בחלק המרכזי של מרתון הפיתוח במהלכו ינסו לפתח את הרעיונות.
זוהי הזדמנות להיחשף, לגעת ולעבוד עם מוצרים טכנולוגיים חדשניים שאינם זמינים לציבור הרחב. אפילו המנטורים בחלקם לא נחשפו לחלק מהמוצרים, או לא נחשפו במלואם.
לצורך כך, נעמיד לרשות המפתחים גישה ישירה, מרחוק, לסביבת וממשקי הפיתוח של מס׳ שותפים ,ביניהן גוגל, כך, שיהיו להם את כל הכלים הדרושים כדי לבצע קפיצת מדרגה משמעותית בפרק זמן קצר.ניתן יהיה לפתח במרבית שפות הקוד הנפוצות. 
במהלך ההאקתון יינתן ליווי צמוד של מומחים טכנולוגיים מהטובים בארץ, שישמשו כמנטורים של הצוותים.
בתום ההאקתון יציג כל צוות במשך 5 דקות (pitch) את המוצר המוגמר שלו בפני חבר שופטים מקצועי ובסיומו יוענקו הפרסים.

המיזם נעשה בשיתוף חברות רבות ושם דגש על הפיתוח הטכנולוגי בדרום ולמען הגדלת הקהילה הדרומית.

 

חשוב חשוב חשוב !!!!!

רישום לאירוע חייב להתבצע דרך אתר האירוע

http://wearsheva.gdg.co.il/

events.name: Technology on a glass of beer
events.description:
We are excited to invite you for joint meetup of Google developers group-Beer sheva and Wix Engineering.

This time the meetup will be a little more startup way, we will meet in the pub! meet great people, enjoy great lectures and drink free Beer! 

In the scheduled:

19:00 - Gathering

19:15 - Ron Miller (VP R&D KitLocate (Yandex.IL)) And  Yoav Cafri CTO KitLocate (Yandex.IL) - Idea to a Company, WeBuy to KitLocate to Yandex. Technology obstacles, POC execution, and What NOT to do.

20:00 - Break

20:15 - Gil Tayar (software architect at Wix) - A Node.js talk about current and future strategies of dealing with async code. 
We'll move from the standard callback, to promises, and from there to es6 generators that yield promises and finally to the es7 async/await. The progression will be a buildup, where each step is explained in terms of the previous step. 

21:00 - Estimated end

Waiting to meet you all.

events.name: Tech on The Bar
Joint GDG Event :  Android + experts panel
events.description:
We are excited to invite you for a joint Meetup
GDG Beer sheva & GDG Herzeliya with  Drippler

In the schedule:

17:00 - Gathering & Mingling. 

17:30 - Android under the hood - demystifying the main thread, Loopers, Services and background tasks.

Different types of services, TheadPoolExcecutors, Advanced use of AsyncTask, Interprocess communication. Let us surprise you when we will go deep into those topics.

 “Understanding more about the architecture and what’s actually going on in the platform will help you write better applications” (Chet Haase and Romain Guy)

We want to take a moment and go deep into Android architecture, we will start our journey when the power button is pressed and Android OS load itself, throughout the formation of the ActivityThread and go all the way to interprocess communication.

The presenters: 

Nir Hartmann, Android Team Lead & Mobile Architect - A journey to the Android Main Thread

Yonatan (V.) Levin, Android Evangelist & Developer at Gett - IPC & AIDL: sexy, not a curse

19:00~ Experts panel - Ask About Android and get answers live. 

Please vote on questions and submit new ones in the following link:
</a><a href="https://app.sli.do/event/2hjosho9/ask">Panel Form

Attending this meetup is not suffice to attend the event.

You need to register to the “Google Next”  event. You can (and should :) ) attend the event itself and then continue to our event, or you can come straight

events.name: Innovate2Educate- Beersheva Hackathon
events.description:
יש לכם רעיון לטכנולוגיה שתשנה את עולם החינוך והלמידה? הירשמו עכשיו למרתון המפתחים Innovate2Educate שיימשך כ-30 שעות ותוכלו לזכות בפרסים כספיים!

כל הפרטים וההרשמה בלינק הבא: 

http://inn2edu.com/

האקתון Innovate2Educate, יאפשר למפתחים, למעצבים, לסטודנטים ולאנשי חינוך, אקדמיה טכנולוגיה ותוכן לחבור יחד בצוותים שייצרו יחדיו את הטכנולוגיות שישנו את אופן החינוך והלמידה בעתיד. משתתפי האירוע ייהנו מליווי מנטורים מעולם החינוך והטכנולוגיה, ייקחו חלק בהרצאות ועוד. כל זאת באירוע אנרגטי וייחודי בשיתוף עם גורמים מובילים בתעשיית ההיי-טק.

ההאקתון מובל על ידי Tech-7 קהילת היזמות והחדשנות של באר שבע והדרום, קהילת GDG באר שבע  ומרכז בנג'יס ליזמות ולחדשנות בפקולטה לניהול ע"ש גילפורד גלייזר, הפקולטה למדעי הבריאות באוניברסיטת בן-גוריון בנגב ובשיתוף עם אגף המחוננים והמצטיינים במשרד החינוך.

המטרה של ההאקתון היא לפעול לאיתור כיווני חשיבה חדשניים לשיפור החינוך והלמידה ככלי לפיתוח דור העתיד של אנשי מקצועות הבריאות והמחקר בתחום. האירוע פתוח לקידום פיתוחים בכל תחומי החינוך וההדרכה תוך נגיעה בכל קבוצות הגיל, המסגרות החינוכיות ושיטות הלמידה.

Innovate2Educate יתקיים במתחם JVP Cyber Labs דבר שהופך אותו להאקתון הראשון המתקיים בפארק גב-ים נגב (פארק תעשיות עתירות ידע) המהווה גורם מוביל בקידום האקו-סיסטם היזמי באזור הדרום. בנוסף, זוכה האירוע לתמיכת עיריית באר שבע והחברות המובילות בעולם וביניהן WIX,EMC, JVP , Wework ועוד

events.name: End of the Year Event - Android Matters
events.description:
We are excited to invite you to our Last event of the year.

This event will be held in the all new WeWork location in Be'er Sheva.

Short Schedule : 

18:15-18:55 Gathering and Mingling. 
Food and Drinks brought to you by Wix and WeWork

~~~~~~~~~~~
19:00-19:45 - Performance Matters by Mr Ran Nachmany
Developer Relations Program Manager at Google
~~~~~~~~~~~
19:50-20:35 - ALL ABOARD!!! by Mr Royi Benyossef 
GDE  & Developer relations manager
~~~~~~~~~~~ 

20:40-21:00 Special TBD

Our schedule for the event is :

18:15-18:55 Gathering and Mingling. 

19:00-19:45 Performance Matters by Mr Ran Nachmany
Developer Relations Program Manager at Google
~~~~~~~~~~~

Our phones are so powerful (we can throw birds on pigs!) that sometimes we forget that they are limited devices, almost embedded. They have limited connectivity, cpu power, memory and power. 

In this talk Ran will talk about improving memory, cpu, networking and battery performance. We'll go through some common mistakes and pitfalls and talk about best practices on how to do things in a better way. 

19:50-20:35  ALL ABOARD!!! - an introspection into the UX of a mobile app's on-boarding flow and how you're doing it wrong.
by Mr Royi Benyossef  GDE  & Developer relations manager
~~~~~~~~~~~

On-boarding flow, first time wizards or introduction slides, no matter how you call them, are a crucial part of a application and the product offering and yet so many developers and companies spend very little time developing it, usually following one of 3 stencils without thinking and in doing so are hurting their product's success in its most delicate point.In this session we'll show a few examples which i saw repeatedly, will challenge their validity while explaining the logic of the thought process behind a good product experience and finally we'll survey a few tools and SDKs which are available for developers.

All the knowledge and information for this session was obtained during sessions as a reviewer in the Google Play UX review project (part of my pro-bono work as a Google (developer) expert) 

20:40-21:00 Special TBD

events.name: Google HashCode Event
events.description:
GDG Beer Sheva - Google HashCode Event

We’ll be hosting a hub at GDG Beer Sheva for the Online Qualification Round of Hash Code, a team-based programming competition created by Google for university students and industry professionals. 

The Online Qualification Round takes place on 11th Feb at 18:30 and registered teams from Beer Sheva and the Negev are invited to participate in our hub, which will take place at Incubit Technology Ventures. 

Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will then be invited to Google’s Paris office to compete in the Final Round of the competition in March.

If you’re interested in joining our hub, find a team (two to four people) and register (MUST!) at g.co/hashcode.  Make sure to select GDG Beer Sheva from the list of hubs when register.

By the way, Google will send us goodies to distribute, so maybe that’s another reason you’ll consider participating :)

events.name: Beyond the Code
events.description:
This time around we'll be taking a hands-on approach to some of the developer skills that add on top of writing code. 

Hope to see you there! Check it out: 

Agenda

19:00 - 19:30 - Gathering, snacks and surprises ^_^

19:30 - 20:00 - Blogging for Developers

20:30 - 21:00 - Product & UX Design in Developer Tools

21:00 - 21:30 - Lockpicking for Hackers (Yes, real life locks!)

Alex Zhitnitsky - GDG Haifa organizer. An engineer on Takipi's product and marketing team, blogging developer content and news for over 170,000 monthly readers.

Guy Isacar - Lead UX/UI designer at Takipi, building the future of developer tools. Previously, he was an art director at an advertising agency. Lives by the Jedi code. 

Michael Sverdlin AKA Sveder - Software developer, GDE (Google Developer Expert) and a mentor on the launchpad program. A 10-year veteran of the Israeli startup scene.

events.name: Data Science to Big Data
events.description:
How­To Start Developing with Machine Learning

Though many buzzwords are floated around, in many cases exploiting data science's potential is challenging. In this talk, we will explain what data science is all about, and how an organization can use it to create meaningful business value. 

Agenda : 

17:30-18:00 Gathering and drinks

18:00-19:15 DATA SCIENCE AND BIG DATA - FROM BUZZWORDS TO BUSINESS VALUE - Dr. Dattner , Prelysis

Dr. Dattner is a statistician and an expert in data science. He has over 15 years of professional experience that includes business management, academic research, and consultancy to organizations ranging from startups to large firms. He is a lecturer (assistant professor) at the University of Haifa’s Department of Statistics.

19:15-19:30 short break; 

19:30-20:30 - How Can You Get Started with Machine Learning-
 Yossi Elkrief , Tikal knowledge , GDG BeerSheva Leader

Description : Curious about machine learning? Come to this event and learn how to get started! The best part about developing with machine learning today is that you can get started with no prior experience. At this event, we’ll introduce “ready to use” APIs from Google Cloud Platform, and TensorFlow, an open source library for machine intelligence.

events.name: Google Hash Code 2017
events.description:
GDG Beer Sheva - Google HashCode Event

We’ll be hosting a hub at GDG Beer Sheva for the Online Qualification Round of Hash Code, a team-based programming competition created by Google for university students and industry professionals. 

Think you could come up with a way to optimize Internet coverage for Project Loon balloons? Or how about routing Google Street View cars through Paris?

Step into the shoes of a Google engineer and tackle these types of challenges during Hash Code, a team-based programming competition for students and professionals (18+) across Europe, the Middle East and Africa organized by Google. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a real-life engineering problem to solve. Are you up for the challenge?

The competition is divided into two stages:

an Online Qualification Round on 23rd February at 18:30 CET

For this round, your team can participate from wherever you’d like, including one of our 

Hash Code hubs

. Hubs allow for teams in the same location (eg. city or university) to compete side-by-side in a more fun and exciting environment.

a Final Round on 1st April

Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to Google Paris to compete in the Final Round of the competition.

Find some teammates and sign up today at g.co/hashcode!

events.name: GDG 2017 - Android Things (IOT)
events.description:
Start Developing IOT with Android Things

Android Things is an extension of the Android platform for IoT and embedded devices. It joins the family of Mobile, Wear, TV, and Auto to bring Android to new form factors. With Android Things, developers can leverage the best-in-class multimedia, connectivity, and rich UI to simplify and accelerate the development of IoT applications.

Agenda : 

17:00-17:30 Gathering and drinks

17:30-19:00 Android Things Overview

Yossi Elkrief, Tikal knowledge, GDG BeerSheva Leader

Idan Argamani, SayVU Technologies, GDG BeerSheva Leader

events.name: Smashing Magazine in Be'er-Sheva!
events.description:
GDG Be'er-Sheva,Wix Be'er-Sheva,  Design South and Starter are combining forces to introduce to you, for the first time in Beer Sheva, Vitaly Friedman!

Smashing Magazine's Co-Founder and a world class speaker, Vitaly will join us to share his knowledge and expertise about Responsive Web Design.
This is a one-time opportunity to join us in this special and exciting event!

The talk will be held in English.

The event is free of charge, but registration is mandatory. Please register here:

https://goo.gl/forms/3OtAXcW0dnRGcQr03

Vitaly Friedman - Smashing Magazine's Co-Founder

Vitaly Friedman loves beautiful content and does not give up easily. From Minsk in Belarus, he studied computer science and mathematics in Germany, discovered the passage a passion for typography, writing and design. After working as a freelance designer and developer for 6 years, he co-founded Smashing Magazine, a leading online magazine dedicated to design and web development. Vitaly is the author, co-author and editor of all Smashing books. He currently works as editor-in-chief of Smashing Magazine in the lovely city of Freiburg, Germany.

Twitter: 

https://twitter.com/smashingmag

GitHub: 

https://github.com/vitalyfriedman

LinkedIn: 

https://www.linkedin.com/in/vitalyfriedman/

Schedule

18:30 - 19:00 - Gathering, drinking & mingling

19:00 - 20:00 - New Adventures in Responsive Web Design / Vitaly Friedman

We all are still trying to figure out just the right strategy for designing and buildings responsive websites just in time. We want to use all of these technologies, but how can we use them efficiently, and how do we achieve it within a reasonable amount of time?

In this talk, Vitaly Friedman, editor-in-chief of Smashing Magazine, will be looking into some practical strategies for crafting fast, resilient and flexible responsive design systems by utilizing all of those wonderful shiny web technologies we have available today. We’ll also talk about dealing with legacy browsers and will cover a few dirty little techniques that might ensure that your responsive websites will stay relevant, flexible and accessible in the years to come.

20:00 - Q&A

See you there! :)

The event is free of charge, but registration is mandatory. Please register here: 

https://goo.gl/forms/3OtAXcW0dnRGcQr03

events.name: Build Actions for Your Community

venue.name: CDI-Negev
venue.address_2: Gav-Yam Hi-tech Park, Building 1, 4th Floor, CDI Compound

events.description:
Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant.

Learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for your community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, you can build something in an area that you care about or are interested in.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam

venue.name: CDI-Negev
venue.address_2: Gav-Yam Hi-tech Park, Building 1, 4th Floor, CDI Compound

events.description:
What is it?
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value).
No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

How long does it take?
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

What is the end result?
Google-hosted badges that attendees can use in their online profiles and show to employers.

events.name: GDG Study Jam
events.description:
What is it?
Learn/Train in one of Google technologies and earn valuable knowledge
and expertise.

How long does it take?
2 hours meetup and as many hours as you can at home :)

What is the end result?
Professional expert trained to tackle new challenges.

events.name: Cross-Platform Development - React Native vs. Flutter
events.description:
Since the beginning of mobile development for iOS and Android, there was always the question of whether cross-platform development, without compromising on the app performance, is possible?

Maybe you are familiar with some of the web-view base solutions, such as Cordova, that are trying to simulate the native UI with web elements, and the result is not good. So, can we do better?

In this meetup, we will introduce the leading cross-platform solutions in the market:
* Flutter by Google
* React-Native by Facebook.

We will understand why companies such as Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Wix, and many others invest in cross-platform technologies.
Following that, we will cover the architecture of these frameworks, the benefits and of course the challenges.

If you are an Android/iOS developer, a web developer, or any developer that wants to get familiar with cross-platform development, this meetup is for you!

// Schedule:
18:00 - 18:30 - Gathering, drinks and food
18:30 - 19:15 - Introduction to React Native / Lev Vidrak
19:15 - 19:25 - break
19:25 - 20:10 - Introduction to Flutter / Moti Bar-Tov

// Introduction to React Native

React Native is Facebooks’s cross-platform framework, allowing developers to compose apps using JavaScript in a declarative way.

At Wix.com we are building our mobile app with React Native from the first commit almost three years ago. Scaling a production-grade application, brought us to understand the real cost-benefit of React Native.

In this talk, we'll start by reviewing React Native's main concepts and understand it's architecture. Continue by covering its great benefits, the challenges we overcome, and those we are still facing.

// Introduction to Flutter

Flutter is Google's new framework for developing beautiful mobile apps based on a single codebase, written in Dart programming language, for both Android and IOS and in the future, for more platforms.

Flutter 1.0 released on December 2018 and its popularity is growing highly these days as there are already thousands of released apps and many companies around the world, are seriously considering it as an option for their new products.

In this meetup, we will take a first look at this framework, learn how we can get started with it, see some apps, discuss its basics concepts such as Widget, Context and State, and answer relevant questions.

// Bio

* Lev Vidrak, mobile developer @ Wix -
For the past 10 years, I work as a software engineer, focusing mostly on mobile development. At Wix I'm working mostly with React-Native, leading the Guild-Masters team.

* Moti Bar-Tov, Mobile developer @ Tikal -
I am an Android developer since 2012, and working at Tikal Mobile group since 2017. As an Android developer I am highly experienced with Java and Kotlin and all of Android api's and libraries such as RxJava, MVP and MVVM architectures. Flutter is my new passion and so far, I've developed my first Flutter app for Tikal, and made a few Flutter lectures at the Droidcon Tel Aviv 2018 event, and at Tikal's Flutter Meetup, and a Flutter workshop in Tikal's Fullstack Techradar event.

This event is brought to you by WIX http://wix.engineering

RSVP here :
https://www.meetup.com/at-wix/events/261038409/?fbclid=IwAR1frAwg7tKeQJFG4V5UC_HvZQ0XA_Y01DYudyeGRvDnpxMHDbjepyj-0_I

events.name: GOOGLE PLAY INSTANT - APPS
events.description:
Native Android apps, without the installation
With Google Play Instant, people can tap to try an app or game without installing it first. Increase engagement with your Android app and gain more installs by surfacing your instant app across the Play Store, Google Search, social networks, and anywhere you share a link.

Android’s new app publishing format, the Android App Bundle, makes it easier than ever to offer a Google Play Instant experience.
Build instant games easily with Cocos and Unity plug-ins.

events.name: AI for Mobile and IoT Devices: TensorFlow Lite
events.description:
What is TensorFlow Lite and how does it fit in a mobile world?
Let's try and explore TensorFlow Lite and learn how to bring ML into a world of connected devices.

events.name: From Zero to ML on Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
From Zero to ML on Google Cloud Platform :

Everyone’s talking about machine learning, but we hear much less about how to put it into practice.

ML became accessible for any developer or data scientist.
Whether you’re completely new to ML or you’ve already trained and deployed your own model from scratch, Google Cloud Platform has a variety of tools to help you start using ML right now.

Start with the basics: how to use a pre-trained ML model with one REST API call. Then learn how to use own dataset to customize a pre-trained model with transfer learning.

Build own model from scratch with TensorFlow
Train and serve it in the cloud with GCP.

upcoming.name: Google Hash Code 2020
upcoming.description:
GDG Beer Sheva - Google HashCode Event

We’ll be hosting a hub at GDG Beer Sheva for the Online Qualification Round of Hash Code (http://g.co/hashcode), a team-based programming competition created by Google for university students and industry professionals.

Think you could come up with a way to optimize Internet coverage for Project Loon balloons? Or how about routing Google Street View cars through Paris?

Step into the shoes of a Google engineer and tackle these types of challenges during Hash Code (http://g.co/hashcode), a team-based programming competition for students and professionals (18+) across Europe, the Middle East and Africa organized by Google.
You pick your team and programming language, we pick a real-life engineering problem to solve. Are you up for the challenge?

The competition is divided into two stages:

Online Qualification Round -
For this round, your team can participate from wherever you’d like, including one of our

Hash Code hubs (https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode/hubs)

. Hubs allow for teams in the same location (eg. city or university) to compete side-by-side in a more fun and exciting environment.

Final Round -

Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to Google Complex to compete in the Final Round of the competition.

Find some teammates and sign up today at http://g.co/hashcode !
